title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while a court case is ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft is updating Windows 11 to eliminate a bypass that allowed users to set up the operating system without an internet connection and logging into an account. This change, revealed in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, enforces the requirement for all devices to be connected and logged in during setup.
summary: Microsoft is updating Windows 11 to remove a workaround that previously enabled users to install the operating system without an internet connection and a Microsoft account. The latest Windows 11 Insider Preview mandates that all devices must be connected to the internet and logged into an account during setup.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway until Monday, March 31st, offering numerous deals that are accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. The sale features over 100 discounts on popular gear, including a selection of budget-friendly options.
summary: Amazon is running its Big Spring Sale until March 31st, offering over 100 discounts on a variety of products. These deals are available to all customers, not just those with an Amazon Prime membership, and include a range of budget-friendly options.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion of debt. This acquisition comes years after Musk initially bought Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, has purchased the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion in debt. This acquisition follows Musk's initial purchase of Twitter for $44 billion.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that won't boot. This feature, first announced last year, is designed to prevent incidents similar to the previous Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This tool allows IT professionals to remotely recover devices that won't boot, aiming to prevent issues like the past Crowdstrike incident.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to Google until next year. This update follows the completion of Google's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021, which initially set a 2025 deadline for the account migration.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to transition their accounts to Google until next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. The original deadline for this migration was set for 2025.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have developed an advanced AI-based model that improves the prediction of chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients. This model uniquely combines whole-slide tumor imaging data with gene expression analyses, surpassing the accuracy of former models that relied on only one type of data.
summary: Researchers have created a new AI model that enhances the prediction of chemotherapy results for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients by integrating whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analyses. This approach outperforms previous models that used only one data type, offering more accurate predictions.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have discovered a link between dopamine levels and cognitive flexibility, finding that increased dopamine production in the brain during challenging tasks leads to more efficient task completion. This insight, gained through PET imaging, could help doctors create better treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Scientists have found that higher dopamine levels in the brain during difficult tasks improve cognitive flexibility, making task completion more efficient. This discovery, made using PET imaging, could aid in developing enhanced treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen

summary: Researchers have found that the immune system can detect and regulate the inactive stage of the Toxoplasma gondii parasite, providing insights into how the body manages latency in various nervous system infections.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: A study analyzing nearly 270,000 seed plant species globally has explored why certain plants flourish in specific regions but not in others. summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species has found that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers are crucial in determining why certain plants thrive in specific areas but not in others. This research sheds light on the patterns of plant distribution and diversity over millions of years.
